title: 111_s1287
content: The Act may be cited as the "Department of Defense Financial Accountability Act of 2009" and includes provisions for auditing the financial statements of the Department of Defense. The Department of Defense Financial Accountability Act of 2009 mandates that the financial statements of the Department of Defense must be validated as audit-ready by September 30, 2017. Subsequent audits must be conducted annually starting from the first fiscal year the statements are ready for audit, with a deadline for completion specified. The Department of Defense Financial Accountability Act of 2009 requires that financial statements be audit-ready within specific timelines. For fiscal year 2017, validation must be completed by September 30, 2019. Subsequent fiscal years must meet validation deadlines within one year after the end of the fiscal year. The Department of the Army's financial statements for a fiscal year must be validated as audit-ready by March 31, 2017. The Department of the Army's financial statements must be audited and validated as audit-ready by March 31, 2017, for the first fiscal year, and by fiscal year 2017 for subsequent years. The audit deadline for financial statements before fiscal year 2017 is within two years after the end of the fiscal year. The Department of the Navy's financial statements must be validated as audit-ready by March 31, 2016, for the first fiscal year, and by one year after the end of the fiscal year for subsequent years. The audit deadline for financial statements after fiscal year 2017 is within one year after the end of the fiscal year. The Department of Navy's financial statements must be audited annually, with the first audit deadline set for fiscal year 2016 and subsequent audits due by September 30, 2018. The Department of the Air Force's financial statements must be validated as ready for audit by September 30, 2016, and audited with an opinion rendered for the first fiscal year they are ready for audit, but no later than one year after the end of the fiscal year. The Department of the Air Force's financial statements must be ready for audit by September 30, 2016, and for each fiscal year thereafter. The deadline for the audit completion varies depending on the fiscal year, with specific timelines outlined for different scenarios. The Defense Logistics Agency's financial statements must be validated as audit-ready by September 30, 2017, and audited with an opinion rendered for each fiscal year starting from fiscal year 2017. The Defense Logistics Agency's financial statements must be audited by specific deadlines: within two years after the fiscal year for years before 2017, by September 30, 2019, for the 2017 fiscal year, and within one year after the fiscal year for years after 2017. The financial statements of the Department of the Army, Navy, and Air Force regarding military equipment must be validated for audit by specific deadlines: December 31, 2013, September 30, 2014, and a date not specified, respectively. The Department of the Air Force must validate financial statements for military equipment by March 31, 2016, and for real property by a date not specified. The Army and Navy have specific deadlines for validating real property financial statements. The financial statements of the Defense Logistics Agency and Department of the Army must be validated for audit by specific deadlines. The Department of the Navy has a deadline for validating inventory financial statements. The financial statements of the Department of the Air Force, Defense Logistics Agency, Department of the Army, and Department of the Navy have specific deadlines for validation for audit. The financial statements of the Department of the Navy, Department of the Air Force, and Department of the Army have specific deadlines for validation for audit regarding operating materials, supplies, and environmental liabilities. The financial statements of the Department of the Navy, Air Force, and Defense Logistics Agency must be validated for audit regarding environmental liabilities by specific deadlines. The Department of the Navy by March 31, 2010, the Air Force by December 31, 2011, and the Defense Logistics Agency by September 30, 2017. The financial statements of the Department of the Army, Navy, and Air Force must be validated for audit with specific deadlines for fund balance with the Treasury. The Army by September 30, 2010, Navy by December 31, 2010, and Air Force by December 31, 2011. The Defense Logistics Agency's financial statements must be ready for audit by September 30, 2011. Audits can be performed by independent auditors if needed. If compliance with audit requirements is not achieved, actions will be taken. The Secretary of Defense or the head of the component must submit a report to Congress within 30 days if compliance with a requirement is not achieved by the specified date. The report should include reasons for non-compliance, actions to be taken, and a proposed new completion date. This subsection does not waive any deadlines for completion. The Under Secretary of Defense (Comptroller) must submit semiannual reports on the financial improvement audit readiness plan to Congress by May 15 and November 15 each year. The reports should detail any deficiencies discovered during the two calendar year quarters ending March 31 and September 30. (g) Definitions.--In this section, the term "appropriate committees of Congress" refers to specific committees in the Senate and House of Representatives. The term "validation" pertains to determining the auditability of financial statements. The auditability of financial statements is determined following an examination to ensure compliance with accounting principles, laws, regulations, and reliable internal controls.
